resources.string: There are no email clients installed on your device…
If you enjoy playing %s, please take a moment to rate it.\nThanks for your support !
Contact me if you have any issue or question.
The game is using AndEngine by Nicolas Gramlich.
You have a %s-players game unfinished, do you want to finish it ?\nIt will be lost if you start another battle.
You must log in\nto play online !
You have not given any order this turn.\nDo you confirm sending orders ?
Are you sure you want to surrender ?

- Amount of damages dealt to your enemies depends mainly on your units' health, morale and experience.
- Experience is earned during battles, the more the fight is undecided the more your units will earn experience.
- Morale is lost each time your units get damages.
- When your army has a morale inferior to 40 percents, it flees the battlefield. Winners get back some morale points after the battle.
- When you are attacking an enemy with units coming from different tiles, you get a damage bonus of 15 percents.
- When protecting a fort or a castle, units only get half of the damages dealt to them.

- Bowmen shoot first during battles, as contact units are moving.\n- Bowmen units with a defense order get a 20 percents bonus on their damages.\n- When accompanied with some contact units, bowmen are protected and can unleash rain of arrows peacufully. If not, their damages are divided by 2 as they are engaged in a contact fight.
- Average army with good skills in defense.
- Basic human unit.\n- Unit capacity : 100\n- Attack power : Average

- Good defense unit, especially with a defense order or in a strong place.
- To be accompanied with a contact unit to be even more effective.
- Unit capacity : 60
- Attack power : Average
- Heavy infantry.\n- Unit capacity : 100\n- Attack power : Great

- Undead have a life steal skill against living armies. When dealing damages, undead units resurrect 15 percents of the dealt damages.\n- Moreover, each time a undead unit is dealing damages, the enemy unit loses 5 percents of morale.
- Weak infantry unit.\n- Unit capacity : 100\n- Attack power : Low

- Good defense unit, especially with a defense order or in a strong place.
- To be accompanied with a contact unit to be even more effective.
- Unit capacity : 60
- Attack power : Average

- Powerful support unit.
- A necromancer unit doubles the life steal of its whole army.
- Unit capacity : 50
- Attack power : Great
- Chaos armies are outnumbered but are only composed of elite troops.\n- Chaos troops never lose morale and will fight until death.
- Strong infantry unit.\n- Unit capacity : 70\n- Attack power : Great

- Good support unit.
Using their powerful demonic spells, the Chaos Wizards cancel enemies' damages during the first round of every battle.
- Unit capacity : 50
- Attack power : Good

- Powerful but expensive unit.
- Demons have a regeneration ability which allows them to get back 15 percents of their health per turn.
- Moreover, they have 15 percents of chance to deal a critical strike (damages x 1.5).
- Unit capacity : 90
- Attack power : Great
- The Orcs and Goblins are some agressive and ruthlessly troops.\n- They get a 20 percents damage bonus when attacking, but they get less bonus than other armies when defending.

- Weak scout unit.
- Goblins do not need any supply when they are in the forests or in the mountains as they are feeding themselves.
- Unit capacity : 70
- Attack power : Low
- Heavy Infantry.\n- Unit capacity : 90\n- Attack power : Good

- Deadly monsters, very effective against the heavy infantry and the toughest troops.
- Trolls have a regeneration capacity which allow them to get back 15 percents of their health per turn.
- Unit capacity : 80
- Attack power : Great
- When fogs of war are activated, forest tiles are invisible to units in diagonal.\n- Bowmen are less efficient in the forest due to the numerous shelters.

- The most important place of your kingdom; lose it and your game is over.
- Hiring units is possible on this tile.
- Gives bonuses to units in defense and heal them.
- Makes you earn 100 gold coins per turn (70 during winter).
- Hiring units is possible on this tile.\n- Gives bonuses to units in defense and heal them.\n- Makes you earn 50 gold coins per turn (35 during winter).
- Gives morale recuperation bonuses.\n- Makes you earn 100 gold coins per turn (70 during winter).
- Heavy infantries cannot climb mountains.\n- Mountains allow you to see further in the fogs of war.
- Each turn a unit is standing on some haunted ruins, it loses morale but gains experience.\n- When leaving the ruins, a unit has one chance out of two to be lost and finally not move.
Do you really want to join this game ?
Your troops await your command, sir !
Basic unit with average skills. Essential to conquer places and to protect bowmen.
Defensive range unit. Deadly when associated to other units, less efficient alone or in the forest.
Powerful contact unit, to be placed in the center of the battles. Expensive to supply, be sure to have stable income.
Here you will learn how to lead your troops to the victory. Use the arrows to navigate through the tutorial.

It means that the game is decomposed into turns, which can last different amount of time. Each turn, players have to send orders to their troops. When every player has played or the time limit is reached, then all the actions are resolved and a new turn is starting !
To win, you have to capture your opponent\'s castles, by attacking them with your armies. You lose the game if at any time you do not control at least one castle...

You can navigate in the map by sweeping the screen with your fingers. The minimap in the bottom left-hand corner allows you to see in which part of the entire map you are at the moment. You can use it to navigate too.

Each turn, you will earn an amount of gold which depends on the number of castles and windmill farms in your kingdom. Each castle or windmill farm under your control makes you earn 100 gold coins per turn, and each fort 50 gold coins; these zones are enlighted in green on the map.
To give a movement order to an army, select it and tap on one the tiles that are enlighted in green. Try to send your infantry on the windmill farm !

To definitely send your turn\'s orders, press the send orders button. Once it is done, you cannot interact anymore with this game until your next turn. One more thing about move orders : a maximum of 3 units of the same owner can be on a single tile at the same time !
Last turn you had sent a unit on this farm zone : as there are no enemies on it, you have successfully conquered it ! You will now earn 200 gold coins per turn !
Kingdom\'s economy, where did my money go ?

Each turn you are earning gold from your territories, but you also need to pay and supply your armies ! When you are buying a new unit, the price indicated is the price you have to paid every turn. If at any time, you do not have enough money to supply your armies, these will lose morale and even desert if they are already demoralized ! A stable economy is definitely a key to success.

Now, it is time to hire fresh troops ! Tap on the icon in the top right-hand corner of your castle tile, and choose the unit you want to hire. Each unit has unique ability. Then click on the send orders button, to finish your turn. Next turn, a new unit will pop up on this tile, unless this tile is already full of your units (3 is the maximum).

When 2 or more different armies are meeting each others on the same tile, or when they cross their path, a battle is engaging. Multiple factors are involved during a battle : the current life of the unit, the types of the units involved, the morale, the experience, the units\' orders, the terrain etc...

All armies have a morale capacity, represented by a blue bar on the top left-hand corner of each unit (near the flag). A unit loses morale when defeating in battles, or when it is not supplied anymore. Each resting turn, units are getting back their morale, more efficiencely on castles and farms. During battle, a low morale army will flee instead of fighting.

All armies have an experience capacity, represented by a green bar on the top left-hand corner of each unit (near the flag). A unit gets experience in battles, especially in long ones. More experienced armies are more efficient in battles.

When attacking you gain bonuses when your armies come from different sides of the battle. In defend, your armies, especially bowmen units, gain bonuses in castles and when they get defense orders. Bowmen are less efficient in the forest and can be quickly demoralized if they are fighting alone.
Be part of the top score by playing and winning more games than the other players !
Balanced army with a great ability to defend positions. Possibility to hire heavy infantry.
Undead units are weak in battle but resurrect when dealing damages to living armies. They also decrease largely opponents\' morale during battles.
A weak unit in battle but which steals life to its enemies, making large hordes hard to defeat.
Defensive range unit. Less efficient alone or in the forest, stealing life when damaging enemies.
Powerful but fragile support unit. When part of a battle, allied units\' life steals are twice more effective.
Waiting for the end of turn...
Another player has already chosen this name, please choose another one...
Play to Warlords Online with me !
You are already friend with him !
The Chaos armies are composed of elite troops that have no notion of fear. Dominate you enemies with deadly spells and devilish monsters !
Chaos Warriors are some extremely dangerous fighters who will never flee the battlefield, even when largely outnumbered.
Chaos Wizards cast tormenting spells which prevent enemies to fight during the first round of battle.
Demons have the ability to deal critical damages and recover from their wounds through time.
The Orcs and Goblins are composed of agressive troops, very effective in attack.
Goblins are one of the weakest creature but are useful for discovering and conquering the lands. They do not need to be supplied when they are in the forest or in the mountain.
Heavy infantry with good fighting skills. They are more effective in attack than in defense.
Trolls have the regeneration ability and deal greater damage to heavy troops.
